Sentencas: During the operation of Solid Oxide Cell (SOC) fuel electrodes, the mobility of nickel can lead to significant changes in electrode morphology, with accompanying degradation in electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes

Sentencas: In this work, the dewetting of nickel films supported on yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ), hereafter called 2D cells, is studied by coupling in-situ environmental scanning electron microscopy (E-SEM), image analysis, cellular automata simulation and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS).
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes

Sentencas: Analysis of experimental E-SEM images shows that Ni dewetting causes an increase in active triple phase boundary (aTPB) length up to a maximum, after which a sharp decrease in aTPB occurs due to Ni de-percolation.
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes

Sentencas: This microstructural evolution is consistent with the EIS response, which shows a minimum in polarization resistance followed by a rapid electrochemical degradation.
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes

Sentencas: These results reveal that neither evaporation-condensation nor surface diffusion of Ni are the main mechanisms of dewetting at 560-800 degrees C. Rather, the energy barrier for pore nucleation within the dense Ni film appears to be the most important factor.
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes

Sentencas: This sheds light on the relevant mechanisms and interfaces that must be controlled to reduce the electrochemical degradation of SOC electrodes induced by Ni dewetting.
Titulo: Unveiling the mechanisms of solid-state dewetting in Solid Oxide Cells with novel 2D electrodes
